main.title: üõ† Batch Rename Tool
intro: Welcome to the Batch Rename Tool!
This tool helps you rename multiple files efficiently.
‚Ä¢ Movie/TV Show Mode - Quick rename for media files
‚Ä¢ Regex Mode - Fully customizable batch renaming
Select your preferred language to continue:

common.not_found_files: No files found to rename (check directory/extension/match conditions).
common.confirm_rename: Confirm to execute the above renaming?

movie_mode.title: == Movie Mode ==
movie_mode.match_type_info: Match type is used to locate 'episode markers'.

match_options.e_digit: E(\d+) - Matches E01, E02, e10 formats (e.g., Show.Name.E22.mkv; case-insensitive by default)
match_options.s_e_digit: S\d+\.E(\d+) - Matches S01.E01, S02.E05 formats (e.g., Show.Name.S01.E22.mkv; case-insensitive by default)
match_options.ep_digit: Ep(\d+) - Matches Ep1, Ep10 formats (e.g., Show.Name.Ep22.mkv; case-insensitive by default)
match_options.custom: Custom regex - Manually enter regex expression, customizable match options

movie_mode.custom_regex_prompt: Enter custom regex (first capture group must be episode number, e.g., E(\d+), only single expression supported)
movie_mode.custom_regex_single_only: Custom mode only supports single regex expression, multiple expressions not supported (cannot contain comma).
movie_mode.custom_regex_valid: Please enter a valid regex expression.
movie_mode.regex_need_capture: Error: Regex must contain at least one capture group (in parentheses) to match episode numbers.
movie_mode.regex_capture_example: Example: In E(\d+), (\d+) is the capture group
movie_mode.match_options_combine: Can be combined, e.g., im, is, ims
movie_mode.match_options_prompt: Enter match options (press Enter for no options)
movie_mode.suffix_info: Suffix = All content from 'episode marker' to extension in filename.

normal_mode.title: == Regex Mode ==
normal_mode.match_instruction_empty: Empty (press Enter) = No matching, directly use subsequent rules for batch renaming
normal_mode.match_instruction_custom: Custom regex = Match specific content in filenames and extract content through capture groups for new filenames
normal_mode.match_instruction_groups: -- Supports multiple capture groups, use $1, $2, $3... in replacement expression to reference
normal_mode.match_instruction_example: -- Example: ([A-Z]+)(\d+) has two capture groups, use $1 and $2 to reference
normal_mode.match_prompt: Enter match item (empty means sequential renaming)
normal_mode.no_capture_groups: Warning: No capture groups in regex, cannot extract content for replacement.
normal_mode.replace_expr_info: Use $1, $2, $3... in replacement expression to reference capture groups.
normal_mode.replace_expr_example: Example: If matching ([A-Z]+)(\d+), you can use '$1_$2' or 'prefix$2' etc.
normal_mode.replace_expr_prompt: Enter replacement expression (use $1, $2... to reference capture groups)
normal_mode.replace_ref_error: Error: Replacement expression references ${max}, but only {total} capture groups.
normal_mode.replace_no_ref_warning: Warning: Replacement expression does not use any capture group references ($1, $2...).
normal_mode.prefix_empty_prompt: Enter prefix (will be used to generate filenames, e.g., file_)
normal_mode.prefix_prompt: Enter prefix (will be used to generate filenames)

utils.padding_width_prompt: Number of digits (for zero-padding, e.g., 2 means 01, 02; 0 means no padding)
utils.padding_width_negative: Number of digits cannot be negative.
utils.conflict_duplicate: Conflict: Multiple source files will be renamed to the same target ->
utils.auto_resolve_conflicts: Automatically add numeric suffix to resolve conflicts?
utils.conflict_resolve_title: Set numeric numbering configuration for conflict resolution:
utils.conflict_resolved: Automatically added numeric suffix to conflicting files.
utils.tmp_files_notice: Note: If aborted, temporary files containing '__tmp__' may remain in the directory, please clean up manually.
